title: FL-170 Declaration for Default - #5 in question
question: I filed Petition, Summons, FL-115, FL-141, FL-150 (preliminary), FL-165 so far. Respondent did not respond nor will take any action on forms. There are no finance, children or property to settle.
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Community property in divorce,Divorce court,Divorce by default judgment,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Family law,Default judgment
answers: Even though you are taking the Respondent's default, and you indicate you have no assets, you are still required to serve upon him your Declaration of Disclosure which includes a Schedule of Assets and Debts (FL-142) or Community and Separate property Declarations (FL-160), a Income and Expense Declaration (FL-150) and a Declaration of Disclosure (FL-140). Someone other than you, who is at least 18 and not a party to the action can mail the documents to the Respondent. You will need to file a Declaration Regarding Service of Declaration of Disclosure (FL-141). Once all that is done, then you would answer #5 on the FL-170 form as "b".
On filling out forms, it is best for you to go to your local superior court and seek their help at their self-help office.
